Jinghui Liu

Physics PhD Candidate @MIT

Jinghui Liu is currently a graduate student in Department of Physics, MIT. She started in the department in 2016, after completing her undergraduate training at Peking University with a Bachelor’s degree of Science in Physics.

She joined in Fakhri Lab located in Physics of Living Systems Center since 2017, and has been working on a series of intriguing projects at the crossing of living systems and non-equilibrium physics.

Check her published and ongoing works at Publications, Google Scholar, and ORCID.

Jinghui is the recipient of the 2016-2017 Morton E. Goulder Presidential fellowship in MIT. She is a finalist for GSNP Student Speaker Award at APS 2020 (virtual). More recently, she has been chosen to speak at the Rising Stars in Soft and Biological Matter Symposium, held by UChicago. In her free time she also works as a student member for MIT’s departmental Resources of Easing Friction and Stress.

(CV).
